High_Valley:
{{short description|Canadian country band}} {{for|the American Viticultural Area|High Valley AVA}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = High Valley | image = | image_size = | caption = High Valley in 2022 | alias = | origin = [[La Crete]], [[Alberta]], Canada | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[bluegrass music|bluegrass]]}} | years_active = 1997–present | label = {{hlist|[[Open Road Recordings|Open Road]]|[[Centricity Music|Centricity (US)]]|[[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]]|[[Warner Music Nashville|Warner Nashville]]|Blue Chair|Cage Free}} | website = {{official website|http://highvalleymusic.com/}} | current_members = Brad Rempel
Dave Myers
Raymond Klassen
Clint Milburn
Andrew Hemmerling | past_members = Bryan Rempel
Curtis Rempel }} '''High Valley''' is a Canadian [[Country music|country]] and [[bluegrass music|bluegrass]] band originally from Blumenort, Alberta, a small community near the hamlet of [[La Crete]]. The group is composed of Brad Rempel (lead vocals) and his supporting band, Dave Myers (bass guitar), Raymond Klassen (Dobro), Clint Milburn (guitar), and Andrew Hemmerling (drums).{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/11/high-valley-reemerges-with-new-music-due-out-nov-12/ | title=High Valley Reemerges with New Music Due Out Nov. 12 | date=4 November 2021 }}{{cite web | url=https://www.countryschatter.com/2016/09/high-valley-know-how-to-turn-a-show-into-a-party/ | title=High Valley know how to turn a show into a party | date=13 September 2016 }} Brad Rempel's brother Bryan Rempel was a member until March 2014,{{cite news|last=Tinson|first=Kayla|title=Bryan Rempel leaving High Valley|url=http://topcountry.ca/bryan-rempel-leaving-high-valley/|access-date=March 12, 2014|newspaper=Top Country|date=March 10, 2014}} while younger brother Curtis Rempel was a member until June 2021.{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|title=Curtis Rempel Announces Exit From Country Duo High Valley To Focus On New Business|url=https://etcanada.com/news/790741/curtis-rempel-announces-exit-from-country-duo-high-valley-to-focus-on-new-business/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210611154717/https://etcanada.com/news/790741/curtis-rempel-announces-exit-from-country-duo-high-valley-to-focus-on-new-business/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 11, 2021|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|date=June 11, 2021}} All three brothers grew up in a [[Mennonite]] community and graduated from La Crete Public School.[http://www.cmt.ca/Artist/HighValley High Valley] at [[CMT (Canada)|CMT]] After a number of chart successes in Canada between 2010 and 2015, High Valley were signed to [[Atlantic Records]] Nashville in October 2015.{{cite news|last1=Nicholson|first1=Jessica|title=High Valley Inks Deal With Atlantic Records/Warner Music Nashville|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2015/10/high-valley-inks-deal-with-atlantic-recordswarner-music-nashville/|access-date=October 9, 2015|work=[[MusicRow]]|date=October 8, 2015}} They achieved some success with the singles "[[Make You Mine (High Valley song)|Make You Mine]]" and "[[She's with Me]]" at [[United States]] country radio. They have three No. 1 hits on the ''Billboard'' [[Canada Country]] chart with "[[I Be U Be]]", "[[Grew Up On That]]", and "[[River's Still Running]]". ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Certifications ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:4em;"| [[Canadian Albums Chart|CAN]]
